chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Francis A Weisfeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

No contact directly or indirectly with the A.M.C. (3-13-04), E.G.S. (8-29-80) or with daughter or wife, only at agents discretion.
No contact with juvenile females.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Comply with Sex Offender Registration
Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent.
